title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5307.1 - Entities required to obtain a casino vendor enterprise license
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5307.1 - Entities required to obtain a casino vendor enterprise license

State Regulations
(a) Any vendor offering goods or services
that directly relate to casino or gaming activity, as described in Racing, Pari-Mutuel Wagering and Breeding Law section 1326(1) and (2), shall be
required to be licensed as a casino vendor enterprise. In addition, the
executive director of the commission may permit an applicant for a casino
vendor enterprise license to conduct business transactions with the gaming
facility applicant or licensee prior to the licensure of such casino vendor
enterprise applicant, effective only for the transaction for which such
permission is requested. (b) In
addition to any vendor required to be licensed by this Part, the commission may
require a license for any person if the issuance of such license would be
consistent with this Part and consistent with the protection of commercial
gaming in the State of New York. Notes
